When these regexes match on all new revisions the notification will be suppressed.
Retrieving revisions and parsing. This might take up to a minute. Don\'t kill the process - it will recover.

No repositories. Press menu key to add one.

Press Back once more to exit.

Turning off SSL certificates may encourage man in the middle attacks. Only check this if you use a self-signed certificate.

Subdroid 0.9.5


~ About ~ 

Subdroid is a simple frontend to look at SVN-Repositories in your Android device. Currently it only supports view-access to SVN repos and is still in a very early development phase. 

~ General Help ~ 

0. General 
Subroid only works with mod_dav_svn subversion servers. the svn:// protocol is not supported. 

1. Repositories 
Use Menu Button to add a new repository. 
Provide the necessary URL and make settings for desired number of revisions that should be downloaded at once. 
If necessary provide the username and password. Please note, that currently self-signed (non pre-installed certificates) are only supported by completely disabling SSL-Certificate checks (any certificate would be accepted!). 
You can choose if you want to retrieve the changed paths for each revision or only the log messages. 
Choose if this repository should be included in the background update check service (currently only available in donate version). 
Longpress on a repository name to modify or delete it. 
NEW: Longpress on a repository name and choose browse to start browsing the repository.


2. Revisions View (after clicking a repository name from the list) 
Use Menu Button to refresh the log (retrieve only new revisions), retrieve more revisions (older ones) or clear it (deletes all revisions). 
By clicking on a changed path you can choose to download or open a revision of this file. If you choose to download it, it will be saved under /sdcard/subdroid/[REPOSITORYNAME][REPOSITORY_DATABASE_ID]/[FILENAME]. You can specifiy within the preferences if you want to open downloaded files right after the download and if no application matches the downlodaed mimetype the text mimetype should be used as a fallback. You might also use a FileManager like Astro to navigate there and open / edit it.


3. Preferences 
Here you can set global preferences like how often the background updateCheck should be executed and what kind of notification (sound, flashing led, vibrating) should be fired.


4. Start update service 
Starts the background service that periodically checks for modifications of the repositories and notifies you when new revisions are committed. 
Once started you can also stop it again from here.


~ Donate / Paid Version ~ 
Contains no ads and has some enhanced features. Features from the donated version will slowly move to the free version while new features are added to the donated version. 
Current donated version includes the possibility to start a background service that periodically checks for modifications to the svn repository.


~ Credits ~ 
The SVN action icons are part of the TortoiseSVN project, it is a great client for svn even if you already use an integrated svn client in your IDE, see http://tortoisesvn.net


~ Changelog ~ 
 
0.9.6 - 2012.04.15 
 * Fixed bug when browsing directories containing "."s (thx Enrico) 
 * Added Holo Layout 
 
0.9.5 - 2012.02.05 
 * ScrollPosition is now saved when downloading a file / changing orientation. 
 * Improved Exceptions a bit 
 
0.9.4 - 2012.01.29 
 * Whoa long time no updates, no spare time :/ 
 * Should be working now again with code.google.com repos. Google decided to send a "405, method not allowed" to all clients not containing "SVN" in the user-agent. How i found out? By tediously reverse engineering and setting all headers tortoise sets on the HTTP PROPFIND requests. 
 * Changed typeface to sans, because someone called me INSANE for using serif. Did I study typography - NO. Do I have taste - Apperently not? Do i care - Not really. Did I change it - Sure. 
 
0.9.3 - 2011.06.26 
 * added export/import features 
 * new theme with bigger revision texts to make it easier to click on them 
 * set new theme to default 
 
0.9.2 - 2011.04.10 
 * fixed crash on Xoom (Honeycomb handles managed cursors differently..) 
 * fixed, or at least alleviated a crash on orientation change 
 * added red error icon when notification service encounters an error (i.e. host unreachable) 
 
0.9.1 - 2011.01.16 
 * Added search button in the menu to allow devices that do not have an dedicated search button to search. 
 * Improved search result page. 
 * Improved notification service, will now use RTC_WAKEUP instead of ELAPSED_REALTIME when not in battery friendly mode. 
 
0.9.0 - 2011.01.08 
 * Added simple search capabilities. Use the search-key on your device to search for author, commit message, or revision-id in all repositories. 
 * some minor improvements regarding text-input 
 
0.8.9 - 2010.10.31 
 * Added copy repo capability 
 * Added regex for author / message that suppresses notification if it matches all new revisions when checking in update service 
 * Added SmallScreenSupport and MidScreenSupport - thought those would be enabled by default (might depend on minSDK param instead of actual sdk used in phone?) 
 * Improved update service notification onclick action 
 
0.8.8 - 2010.10.16 
 * Added Themes - that was a lot harder as i thought. Friggin background issues! 
 * Added LargeScreenSupport, improved messages and icons 
 
0.8.7 - 2010.07.10 
 * Bugfix for self-signed SSL certificates and froyo 2.2 (thx Todd for reporting this) 
 
0.8.6 - 2010.07.03 
 * Repositories can now be browsed! use longpress - browse repository 
 * Fixed a bug with whitespace in urls 
 * Fixed bug that showed changed paths for wrong revision when scrolling. 
 
0.8.5 - 2010.05.24 
 * Move Application to sdcard is supported 
 * Downloaded files are opened (if content-type / mimetype is recognized) 
 * Opening after downloading / falling back to text-mimetype configurable through preferences 
 
0.8.4 - 2010.05.15 
 * Linked changesets can now be downloaded or openend. The revision that should be opened/downloaded can be chosen. Files will be saved under /sdcard/subdroid/.. 
 * Linked changesets now also available in free version, but only opening head revision in browser is available. 
 * Password can now be chosen to not be safed. Will prompt for it on update; ServiceUpdate not possible (will be skipped) for these repos. 
 
0.8.3 - 2010.05.09 
 * Increased font-size of revision list. Why has no one ever told me it turns out to be so friggin small on real devices? 
 * Preference introduced that allows to specify whether the head-revision of a file should be opened, or the version of the file that belongs to this changeset / revision (currently donate only). 
 * Changed name of paid / pro / donated version, to distinguish it from the free version when both are installed on one device. 
 
0.8.2 - 2010.04.23 
 * revisions should now always be displayed in the correct order, thanks to ledoerr for reporting this 
 * changed to standard preference view 
 * changed paths are now clickable and open the most recent version in the browser (donate only) 
 
0.8.1 - 2010.04.09 
 * removed some unneeded files, minor spelling fixes 
 
0.8.0 - 2010.04.09 
 * First Release
